intro: Marlierea insculpta, commonly known as the sculpted marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, deeply lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
